ghostPost.title: Typeform
ghostPost.excerpt: Embed forms on your site with Typeform and survey your readers or add contact forms!
ghostPost.meta_description: Survey your readers or add a contact form to your site with Typeform ðŸ‘‰Ghost integrates your forms seamlessly using sensible embeds and code injection.

ghostPost.plaintext:
You can get Typeform working with Ghost as a free, embedded way to survey
readers or allow them to contact you directly.

Typeform is a versatile data collection tool for professionals which can be used
to build both simple and complex form submission workflows. Thousands of people
use Typeform because of its friendly, easy to use interface for collecting
submissions - and powerful features for processing them, even to the point of
collecting file uploads and payments.

To start integrating with Ghost, head over to Typeform
[https://www.typeform.com]  and create a new form.

Create a form and share
Once you're happy with your form settings, head over to the Share  tab of the
form builder, and select Embed

Get the embed code and make a copy
Press the Get the code  button and then copy the provided JavaScript snippet

Within the Ghost editor, add a new HTML card
You can paste the form code within an HTML card on any page to embed your form

Add some automation to submissions
To make your form more powerful, consider adding some automation by using Zapier
[https://zapier.com]  to process your form submissions. There are tons of things
you can do with it, but here are some ideas to get you started:
ghostPost.html:
You can get Typeform working with Ghost as a free, embedded way to survey readers or allow them to contact you directly.

Typeform is a versatile data collection tool for professionals which can be used to build both simple and complex form submission workflows. Thousands of people use Typeform because of its friendly, easy to use interface for collecting submissions - and powerful features for processing them, even to the point of collecting file uploads and payments.

To start integrating with Ghost, head over to Typeform and create a new form.

Create a form and share

Once you're happy with your form settings, head over to the Share tab of the form builder, and select Embed

Get the embed code and make a copy

Press the Get the code button and then copy the provided JavaScript snippet

Within the Ghost editor, add a new HTML card

You can paste the form code within an HTML card on any page to embed your form

Add some automation to submissions

To make your form more powerful, consider adding some automation by using Zapier to process your form submissions. There are tons of things you can do with it, but here are some ideas to get you started:
